metadata.title: CVE-2021-47320 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfs:fix acl memory leak of posix_acl_create() When looking into another nfsxfstests report, I found acl and default_acl in nfs3_proc_create() andnfs3_proc_mknod() error paths are possibly leaked. Fix them in advance.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163').
